question_text: A 29-year-old woman with Crohn disease has a painful chronic ulcer near her ostomy site, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is pyoderma gangrenosum (Option C). Pyoderma gangrenosum typically presents with a tender papule, pustule, or nodule that develops into an exudative ulcer. Lesions can be single or multiple and usually appear on the lower extremities and near ostomy sites. Diseases most commonly associated with pyoderma gangrenosum are inflammatory bowel diseases, rheumatoid arthritis, seronegative spondylarthritis, and hematologic disease or malignancy, most commonly acute myeloid leukemia.
